Gary_LeVox:
{{short description|American vocalist (born 1970)}} {{Infobox musical artist | image = GaryLeVoxHWOFSept2012.jpg | caption = LeVox in September 2012 | background = solo_singer | birth_name = Gary Wayne Vernon Jr. | birth_date = {{Birth date and age |1970|7|10}} | birth_place = [[Powell, Ohio]], U.S. | spouse = {{marriage|Tara Vernon|1999}} | instrument = Vocals, guitar, drums, harmonica | genre = [[Country music]]
[[Country rock|country rock]]
[[Country pop|country pop]] | occupation = Singer, songwriter | years_active = 1984–present | label = [[Lyric Street Records|Lyric Street]], [[Big Machine Records|Big Machine]] | past_member_of = [[Rascal Flatts]] | website = {{URL|rascalflatts.com}} }} '''Gary LeVox''' (born '''Gary Wayne Vernon Jr.''', July 10, 1970) is an American singer and songwriter. He is best known for being the lead vocalist of the contemporary [[Country music|country music]] band [[Rascal Flatts]],Keyes, J. Edward (2007-09-25). "[https://www.rollingstone.com/music/blogs/staff-blog/single-minded-new-foo-fighters-joni-mitchell-rascal-flatts-keyshia-cole-and-kymani-marley-20070925 Single Minded: New Foo Fighters, Joni Mitchell, Rascal Flatts, Keyshia Cole and KyMani Marley] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140727041331/http://www.rollingstone.com/music/blogs/staff-blog/single-minded-new-foo-fighters-joni-mitchell-rascal-flatts-keyshia-cole-and-kymani-marley-20070925 |date=2014-07-27 }}". ''[[Rolling Stone]]''. Retrieved on 2008-03-20. and his stage name was taken from the studio-console label for his lead-vocal track.(April 3, 2006), "Finally, one of the 'Gang'". ''USA Today''. :01d == Biography == === Early life === LeVox was born in [[Powell, Ohio]].[http://music.aol.com/artist/gary-levox/biography/1435363 AOL music, Gary LeVox biography] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080202040125/http://music.aol.com/artist/gary-levox/biography/1435363 |date=2008-02-02}} Retrieved 2008-03-20 LeVox's first musical performance was at the age of eight, in a play at his church. He graduated from [[Olentangy High School]] and is an alumnus of [[Ohio State University]]. Prompted by his cousin, LeVox moved to [[Nashville, Tennessee]], in 1997.[http://www.rascalflatts.com/site.php?content=biography Rascal Flatts.com] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080306132020/http://www.rascalflatts.com/site.php?content=biography |date=2008-03-06 }} Retrieved 2008-03-20 === Rascal Flatts === {{Main|Rascal Flatts}} [[File:Gary LeVox.jpg|thumb|right|LeVox performing in 2005]] LeVox and his second cousin, [[Jay DeMarcus]], started out together in singer [[Chely Wright]]'s band. When the regular guitarist was not available, [[Joe Don Rooney]] stepped in. The three men say they felt chemistry immediately and afterwards formed Rascal Flatts.Price, Deborah Evans (December/January 2008), "The Triumph of Rascal Flatts". ''CMA Close Up'' volume unknown:20-21 === Post-Rascal Flatts === The band disbanded in 2021, after which LeVox began releasing solo music. In May 2021, he released his first solo EP, ''One on One''.[https://www.eonline.com/news/1271854/how-gary-levox-is-spreading-hope-through-music-after-rascal-flatts-farewell How Gary LeVox Is Spreading Hope Through Music After Rascal Flatts' Farewell] This was followed in 2022 by a single titled "Get Down Like That" on [[Big Machine Records]], the label to which Rascal Flatts was previously signed.{{cite web | url=https://musicmayhemmagazine.com/gary-levox-releases-new-party-anthem-get-down-like-that-co-written-by-thomas-rhett-hardy/ | title=Gary LeVox Releases New Party Anthem "Get Down Like That," Co-Written by Thomas Rhett & HARDY [LISTEN] | date=20 August 2022 }} ==Personal life== LeVox has been friends with [[Jamie Foxx]] since the mid-1990s, and Foxx made a guest appearance on the album ''[[Still Feels Good]]''. {{blockquote|"We used to sit around for hours at Jamie’s house, singing and playing and having a good time...So when Jay and Joe and myself wrote this song, we thought it would be great to have him on it. I called him up just to say, ‘Hey, man, you’ve got to hear this song. I think you could really, really kill it.’ He said, ‘Tell you what. I’ll sing on your record if you guys will sing on mine.’ I said, ‘All right.’"|Gary LeVox (2007)}} LeVox was employed in his local burger bar from age 14 after which he started an [[AC/DC]] cover band with his close childhood friends. LeVox has been married to Tara Vernon since May 1999. He says it was love at first sight when they met backstage at a gospel festival concert. "I knew at that moment that I was looking at my future wife," he said in a 2011 interview. "It was the weirdest thing ever." They have two daughters together, Brittany, born in 2000, and Brooklyn, born in 2004. ==Discography== {{Main|Rascal Flatts discography}} *''[[Rascal Flatts (album)|Rascal Flatts]]'' (2000) *''[[Melt (Rascal Flatts album)|Melt]]'' (2002) *''[[Feels Like Today]]'' (2004) *''[[Me and My Gang]]'' (2006) *''[[Still Feels Good]]'' (2007) *''[[Unstoppable (Rascal Flatts album)|Unstoppable]]'' (2009) *''[[Nothing Like This (album)|Nothing Like This]]'' (2010) *''[[Changed (album)|Changed]]'' (2012) *''[[Rewind (Rascal Flatts album)|Rewind]]'' (2014) *''[[The Greatest Gift of All]]'' (2016) *''[[Back to Us]]'' (2017) ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *{{IMDb name | id=1688108 | name=Gary LeVox}} {{Rascal Flatts}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Levox, Gary}} [[Category:1970 births]] [[Category:American country singer-songwriters]] [[Category:American male singer-songwriters]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Singer-songwriters from Ohio]] [[Category:Ohio State University alumni]] [[Category:Musicians from Columbus, Ohio]] [[Category:Rascal Flatts members]] [[Category:American people of Croatian descent]] [[Category:21st-century American singer-songwriters]] [[Category:Country musicians from Ohio]] [[Category:21st-century American male singers]] [[Category:Big Machine Records artists]]
